Package renderer.scene.primitives

Class OrientablePrimitive

java.lang.Object
renderer.scene.primitives.Primitive
renderer.scene.primitives.OrientablePrimitive
Direct Known Subclasses:
Face, Triangle, TriangleFan, Triangles, TriangleStrip
public abstract class OrientablePrimitive extends Primitive
An OrientablePrimitive is a Primitive that can be given an orientation, so it has a both a front and a back face.

We have five orientable geometric primitives,

  • Face,
  • Triangle,
  • TriangleStrip,
  • TriangleFan,
  • Triangles.

Each OrientablePrimitive holds three lists of integer indices.

One list is of indices into its Model's List of Vertex objects. These are the vertices that determine the primitive's geometry.

The other two lists are lists of indices into its Model's List of Color objects. One index list determines the OrientablePrimitive's front facing colors and the other index list determines the OrientablePrimitive's back facing colors.

The three lists of integer indices must always have the same length. For every Vertex index in a OrientablePrimitive there must be a front face Color index and a back face Color index.

    • cIndexList2

      public final List<Integer> cIndexList2

  • Constructor Details

    • OrientablePrimitive

      protected OrientablePrimitive()
      Construct an empty OrientablePrimitive.

    • OrientablePrimitive

      protected OrientablePrimitive(int... indices)
      Construct a OrientablePrimitive with the given array of indices for the Vertex and Color index lists. Make the backface colors the same as the front face colors.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this OrientablePrimitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this OrientablePrimitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      indices - array of Vertex and Color indices to place in this OrientablePrimitive

    • OrientablePrimitive

      public OrientablePrimitive(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList)
      Construct a OrientablePrimitive object using the two given Lists of integer indices. Make the backface colors the same as the front face colors.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if vIndexList and cIndexList are not the same size

    • OrientablePrimitive

      public OrientablePrimitive(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList2)
      Construct a OrientablePrimitive object using the three given Lists of integer indices.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      cIndexList2 - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList2 is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of any one of the index lists is not the same as the others

  • Method Details

    • addIndex

      public void addIndex(int... indices)
      Add the given array of indices to the Vertex and Color index lists. Make the backface colors the same as the front face colors.

      NOTE: This method does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this OrientablePrimitive's Model object. This method assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this OrientablePrimitive gets rendered).

      Overrides:
      addIndex in class Primitive
      Parameters:
      indices - array of Vertex and Color indices to add to this OrientablePrimitive

    • addIndices

      public void addIndices(int vIndex, int cIndex)
      Add the given indices to the Vertex and both Color index lists. Make the backface color the same as the front face color.

      NOTE: This method does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this OrientablePrimitive's Model object. This method assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this OrientablePrimitive gets rendered).

      Overrides:
      addIndices in class Primitive
      Parameters:
      vIndex - integer Vertex index to add to this OrientablePrimitive
      cIndex - integer Color index to add to this OrientablePrimitive

    • addIndices

      public void addIndices(int vIndex, int cIndex, int bIndex)
      Add the given indices to the Vertex and Color index lists.

      NOTE: This method does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this OrientablePrimitive's Model object. This method assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this OrientablePrimitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndex - integer Vertex index to add to this OrientablePrimitive
      cIndex - integer front face Color index to add to this OrientablePrimitive
      bIndex - integer back face Color index to add to this OrientablePrimitive

    • setBackFaceColorIndex

      public void setBackFaceColorIndex(int... cIndex)
      Give this OrientablePrimitive the back face Color indexed by the given color index. Assign multiple backface indices in a cyclical manner.

      NOTE: This method does not put any Color objects into this OrientablePrimitive's Model object. This method assumes that the given indices is valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      cIndex - integer back face color index for this OrientablePrimitive

      For debugging.

      String representation of this OrientablePrimitive object
